intro: Linaria corsica, commonly known as the Corsican toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Corsica. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces bright yellow, tubular flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Linaria corsica is adapted to rocky and dry environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh Mediterranean climates.
